title: Lesson 57
paragraph: Storytelling and memory capture experiences to create connections. Consistency and awareness of details enhance retention and narrative power.

words.meaning: capable of being told as a story
words.example: Her journey is narrativeable and inspiring.
He stayed awake during the lecture.
She maintained a consistent study routine.

words.meaning: a legally recognized member of a country
words.example: Every citizen has the right to vote.

words.meaning: a professional who helps with mental or physical health
words.example: She visited a therapist to cope with stress.

words.meaning: a person or place entrusted with something
words.example: The bank acts as a depositary of funds.
The carnival attracted tourists from all over.

words.meaning: system of money in a country

words.example: She dipped the brush into the paint.

words.meaning: the edible product of a plant; result
words.example: The project bore fruit after months of work.
